intro: Junellia alba, commonly known as the white junellia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its showy, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Junellia alba produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
